Function reference

Downloading ‘many* packages’ and inspecting data

These functions assist data analysts with the download and inspection of ‘many* packages’ and their data

get_packages()
Find and download packages in the many packages universe
plot_releases()
A plotting function that visualises historical milestones/releases
data_source() data_contrast() data_evolution() open_codebook()
Set of data structure exploration functions for users

Visualising ‘many’ packages data

These functions assist data analysts with the visualisation of data on particular domains of global governance

db_plot() db_comp()
Database profile functions
network_map()
Plot geographical networks

Consolidating many databases

These functions assist data analysts with the analysis of data on particular domains of global governance

consolidate()
Consolidate database into a single dataset
reexports pluck
Selects a single dataset from a database
favour() favor()
Favour datasets in a database

Data wrangling with manydata

Ensembled data adds special challenges to data wrangling. These functions assist analysts with wrangling such data

transmutate()
Drop only columns used in formula
recollect()
Pastes unique string vectors
reunite()
Pastes unique string vectors
repaint()
Fills missing data by lookup
coalesce_rows()
Get first non-missing
retrieve_bilaterals() retrieve_multilaterals() retrieve_membership_list() retrieve_links() retrieve_texts()
Retrieve international treaties
emperors
Emperors database documentation

manydata
